0.title: 1980s BESTSELLERS

7.title: THE WORLD OF NAT KING COLE
clues: She's the threshold lassie being crooned over by Nat King Cole here"Many dreams have been brought to your doorstep, they just lie there..."
Five-word song title the precedes the lyric line heard here"It will be forever..."

The two things required of you in the title of this song"A brother took a monkey for a ride in the air /The monkey thought that everything was on the square /The brother tried to throw the monkey off his back /But the monkey grabbed his neck and said, 'Now listen, Jack...'"
It's the travelin' lyric line that follows Nat singing here"If you ever plan to motor west..."
6-word suggestion in the title of this hit"There may be trouble ahead..."

10.title: SEEING THE LIGHT
clues: "Brighter than a Thousand Suns" is a 1956 book about the men who built the first one of these
"The sun's coming up"?  No, this character says, "Envious streaks do lace the severing clouds in yonder east"
This phrase, meaning the prospect of relief after struggle, is reported as part of near-death experiences
"The people that walked in darkness have seen a great light" is sung in this opus at Christmastime
The Psalmist sayeth, "Thy word is" this (also an old CBS religious show) "and a light unto my path"

11.title: UNKNOWN SPANIARDS
clues: All the unknown senoritas were interested in this desirable bachelor whose name can also mean "qualified"
He was named for his sub-high school level of formal education

It was futile to try to capture or pin down the man with this name
